subproject.description:
AGL is active in the four neediest areas of the country, characterized by high poverty rates and raging socioeconomic problems: North, South, Bekaa and Beirut Southern Suburbs. The programme is managed at country level by UNDP in partnership with its national counterpart the Council for Development and Reconstruction (CDR).

The ART GOLD is based on a cooperation framework between local, national and international partners interested in combining and coordinating their efforts to achieve the Millennium Development Goals (MDGs) and to contribute to local governance, decentralization, and balanced socio-economic development in the medium and long term.
	
The key goal of the UNDP AGL Programme is to promote the participation of the widest range of public, private, and civil stakeholders in the planning and implementation of the local development process. This territorial participatory approach aims to avoid the duplication and fragmentation of projects. It encourages organization and cohesion within local communities and is a powerful incentive for communities to be held locally accountable. This has an immediate return in terms of stability, security, and respect of law.
subproject.title: ART GOLD LEBANON

subproject.description:
Development of a local network entitled to improve long-term strategic socio-economic development in the region through communication and cooperation between the municipalities and centres for development services and the charity organizations associations. This is carried out based on a strategic development plan associated with the concerned ministries.

Monitoring the activities at the primary health care centres to ensure the implementation of the appropriate approach to primary health care. 

Implementation of various activities, such as: health education; identification and monitoring of the prevalent health problems; raising awareness on proper nutrition and maternal and child care including immunization and family planning; prevention from chronic diseases and enhancing psychiatric health; provision of essential drugs, etc.
subproject.gender code: Gender equality as a significant objective
subproject.title: Art Gold Beirut Southern Subur

subproject.title: ART GOLD- SOUTH

subproject.description:
While the forests of Lebanon are a unique feature in the arid environment of the eastern Mediterranean, they are currently facing serious threats. The consequences of the current forest degradation on the ecosystem and its components are translated into soil erosion, loss of fauna and flora biodiversity, micro-climate change, loss of soil organic matter and soil fertility, desertification, decrease in soil water infiltration and stored underground water, as well as increase in run-off which leads to mudslides and floods, lower agricultural productivity, and negative impact on the socio-economic and livelihoods of local communities.

The long-term goal of this project is community-based protection and restoration of forest and woodland resources as contribution to greater ecosystem stability and improved rural livelihoods. The immediate objective is to establish a pilot forest, fruit tree & fruit tree nursery including herb production in West Bekaa, providing a source of income for local communities and municipalities while providing support to MoE in implementing the National Reforestation Plan.
subproject.gender code: Gender equality as a significant objective
subproject.title: ART GOLD- WEST BEKAA

subproject.title: ART GOLD- WEST BEKAA

subproject.description:
The project is focusing on:
 Increasing income generation and job opportunities by focusing on agriculture and agro-industries (milk, beekeeping, fruits and vegetables, fishery and handicraft) 
 Activating the role of agricultural extension through the establishment of a soil and water laboratory at the Lebanese Agricultural Research Institute (LARI)
 Implementating a project to improve the productivity of dairy cows in cooperation with the Agricultural Cooperative Association for Livestock Breeding and Feed Cultivation and Processing in Akkar.
 Implementating a project to improve the services provided to the fishermen in Al Abdeh port in Akkar, and to increase their productivity through the provision of fishing techniques and the distribution of new equipment. 
 Implementating of projects to support beekeepers and improve their productivity, in addition to working on the rehabilitation of pastures through the cultivation of nectar types of plants that constitute the main source of food for bees in the regions of Akkar and Minnieh-Dinnieh.
subproject.gender code: Gender equality as a significant objective
subproject.title: ART GOLD- NORTH

subproject.title: ART GOLD- NORTH

subproject.description: The project’s aim is to establish a Guarantee Fund for increasing the opportunities of access to credit for micro, small and medium enterprises and business cooperatives, identified by UNDP ART GOLD Lebanon and later by the Local Economic Development Agencies. Its main objective is to contribute to local economic development as an attempt for poverty alleviation and inclusive participation of local communities in their well-being. The project is linked to the UNDP ART GOLD Programme which supports the local actors in sharing comprehensive territorial development strategy in order to decrease the risks of business failures. This approach is based upon the identification of strategic market areas and consequent prioritization at sectoral and territorial level for the optimum utilization of the local resources, business growth, easy access to credit (small and medium loans), capacity development, and territorial marketing strategies. In order to achieve these objectives UNDP AGL is establishing Local Economic Development Agencies (LEDAs) in each area of the Programme, which will provide the necessary and permanent support to the above mentioned development strategy. CDR, through the Economic and Social Fund for Development will be the national implementing agent of this component, particularly for the establishment of the Guarantee Fund at one national bank and further on for the management of the this agreement aiming at enabling the local SMEs and cooperatives to have easy access to credits for their business development.
subproject.title: Access to Credits
